channel.title: Fixed
channel.description: Hey guys, i have almost everything ready for my server. i have already portforward it and allowd the port through my firewall, all thats left to do is make my client downloadable. How exactly would i do this, i know i need an ftp which im pretty sure ive already got. Can any1 help me out? Thanks :)

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

What revision is your client/source?

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @gimpie gimpie
item.description:
@gimpie wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:517683”][quote author=gimpie link=topic=635945.msg4287475#msg4287475 date=1366602211]

Register for an account, and when you log in, there will be a button somewhere on the page that you can click in order to upload files.
Do that, click on the ‘From Computer’ button (on most fileshare sites that will be an option), and upload your client folder.
Make sure it is compressed before uploading.

Ok thanks ill give this a try
[/quote]
Or, I mean. The super simple alternative is just use the .jar that will be made for the webclient. That’s what I do.[/quote]

I just used the .jar maker to make it a dl client, problem is though now when i try to click the client.jar it wont open, so i clicked run (the run for the .jar) and it says could not find or load mainclass client… any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“gimpie, post:8, topic:517683”][quote author=J_P link=topic=635945.msg4287473#msg4287473 date=1366601917]
Register for an account, and when you log in, there will be a button somewhere on the page that you can click in order to upload files.
Do that, click on the ‘From Computer’ button (on most fileshare sites that will be an option), and upload your client folder.
Make sure it is compressed before uploading.
[/quote]

Ok thanks ill give this a try[/quote]
Or, I mean. The super simple alternative is just use the .jar that will be made for the webclient. That’s what I do.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @J_P J_P
item.description:
@J_P wrote:

Again, be sure that the client’s connecting IP is set to your server’s connecting IP address.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @gimpie gimpie
item.description:
@gimpie wrote:

[quote=“J_P, post:6, topic:517683”]Register for an account, and when you log in, there will be a button somewhere on the page that you can click in order to upload files.
Do that, click on the ‘From Computer’ button (on most fileshare sites that will be an option), and upload your client folder.
Make sure it is compressed before uploading.[/quote]

Ok thanks ill give this a try

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“gimpie, post:5, topic:517683”][quote author=J_P link=topic=635945.msg4287471#msg4287471 date=1366601637]
Upload it to a filesharing website, such as MediaFire or Uppit.
[/quote]

Well obviously, my question is how would i do this, how would i make my client downloadable, so i can put it up on one of those sites.[/quote]
Copy the client, delete all the .java files in one of the copy’s, not both. Right click the folder with the copy without .java files, and Hover “Send To…” Then when the tree shows up click the “Zip” option.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @J_P J_P
item.description:
@J_P wrote:

Register for an account, and when you log in, there will be a button somewhere on the page that you can click in order to upload files.
Do that, click on the ‘From Computer’ button (on most fileshare sites that will be an option), and upload your client folder.
Make sure it is compressed before uploading.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @gimpie gimpie
item.description:
@gimpie wrote:

J_P:

Upload it to a filesharing website, such as MediaFire or Uppit.

Well obviously, my question is how would i do this, how would i make my client downloadable, so i can put it up on one of those sites.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @J_P J_P
item.description:
@J_P wrote:

Upload your client to a filesharing website, such as MediaFire or Uppit.
Make sure that the client is set to your connecting IP when you upload it, otherwise others won’t be able to connect.

Read full topic
